quotes: Years of service 1956–1994
He was the first Force Commander and Head of Mission of UNPROFOR, the United Nations Protection Force in the former Yugoslavia during 1992–1993.
During 1977-1979, Nambiar was a part of the Indian Army Training team in Iraq.
During 1983-1987, he worked as a Military Adviser at the High Commission of India, London.
He retired as the Deputy Chief of the Army Staff (India) in 1994.
He served on the United Nations High Level Panel on 'Threats, Challenges and Change', which provided basis for the UN Secretary General's report to the 2005 World Summit.
Since 2011, he is a distinguished fellow of the Institute for Defence Studies and Analyses, New Delhi.
Vir Chakra, for Operation Cactus-Lilly (1971).
Padma Bhushan, 2009.
Commander UNPROFOR 1992–1993

roles.title: Commander
quotes: Commander UNPROFOR 1992–1993
Born in Bombay (now Mumbai) on 30 August 1936, to Kunhananthan Nambiar and Chenicheri Devikutty.
He was educated mostly in Poona (present-day Pune) and Bombay, and is an alumnus of St. Xavier's College, Bombay.
